c74object.name: ears.peaks~
c74object.description: Find the spectral of temporal peaks of an incoming buffer

inlet.digest: Source temporal buffer or spectrogram magnitudes
inlet.description: If you want to compute the peaks of a temporal buffer, send it in the first inlet; if you want to compute the peaks of a spectral representation, send the magnitudes here (and optional phases in the second inlet)

outlet.description: Outputs peaks organized as follows: one llll per channel, then one llll per frame with the onset as first element, then one llll per peak, each peak being in the form: [position amplitude phase], where phase is only present if a temporal buffer or a phase spectrogram has been provided.

objarg.name: outname
objarg.description: The outname attribute sets a name (or a wrapped list of names) for each of the buffer outles of the objects in ears. These names are only accounted for if the alloc mode is 'Static'.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: list/llll
method.description: A list or llll with buffer names will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the alloc attribute). If the input buffer is a spectral buffer, then magnitudes and phases are expected to be input from the two inlets. Otherwise, only the temporal buffer is expected to be input from the left inlet, and a Short-Time Fourier Transform will be performed.

method.name: reset
method.description: If the alloc attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used buffer name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: stop
method.description: When a stop message is sent to an object with blocking attribute set to 0, the computation is aborted as soon as possible.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeaiff
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writemp3
writeraw
method.digest: Save output as raw file with no header
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format

method.name: writewv

attribute.name: ampunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for amplitudes: Linear (default) or Decibel (0dB corresponding to 1. in the linear scale).

attribute.name: angleunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for angles: Radians (default), Degrees, or Turns.

attribute.name: blocking
downmix
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to downmix all the channels into one. If this flag is not set, then one buffer per channel is output.

attribute.name: framesize
attribute.description: Sets the analysis frame size or window size (the unit depends on the antimeunit attribute)

attribute.name: hopsize
attribute.description: Sets the analysis hop size (the unit depends on the antimeunit attribute) Floating point values are allowed.

attribute.name: interpolate
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to perform cubic interpolation to find 'true' peaks.

attribute.name: maxpeaks
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of peaks, 0 means: all.

attribute.name: minpeakdistance
attribute.description: Sets the minimum distance between the peaks

attribute.name: numframes
attribute.description: Sets the number of analysis frames. Defaults to "auto", as this number is a consequence of the framesize and hopsize attributes. If this number is set to a positive integer value, the hopsize is ignored and inferred from numframes.

attribute.name: orderby
attribute.description: Sets the ordering type (either "position" or "amplitude").

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.

attribute.name: overlap
attribute.description: Sets the overlap factor between the analysis window size and the hop size.

attribute.name: peakampthresh
attribute.description: Sets a threshold, so that peaks with amplitude below this threshold are discarded.

attribute.name: spectral
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to run spectral analysis on non-spectral buffers. By default it is on, but if you want to analyze peaks of an ordinary temporal buffer, turn this off.

attribute.name: threshampunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for amplitudes: Linear (default) or Decibel.

attribute.name: timeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length), The default varies depending on the modules.

attribute.name: winstartfromzero
attribute.description: If on, the first window is centered at framesize/2; if off (default), the first window is centered at zero.

attribute.name: wintype
attribute.description:
Sets the window type. Available windows are: "rectangular", "triangular", "sine", "hann", "hamming", "blackman", "nuttall", "blackmannuttall", "blackmanharris", "gaussian", "sqrthann", "sqrthamming".
For objects that may require different windows for analysis and synthesis, two symbols can be defined (the first one being the analysis window, the second one being the synthesis window).

c74object.discussion: If an ordinary (temporal) buffer is input, by default a Short-Time Fourier Transform is computed and its peaks are found. If one wants temporal peaks instead, one should set the spectral attribute to zero. If a spectral buffer is input (with as many channels as bins), then the peaks are directly computed from the spectral representation.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (symbol)
entry.description: Source temporal buffer or spectrogram magnitudes. If you want to compute the peaks of a temporal buffer, send it in the first inlet; if you want to compute the peaks of a spectral representation, send the magnitudes here (and optional phases in the second inlet)

entry.name: Inlet 2 (symbol)
entry.description: Optional buffer containing spectrogram phases. Source spectrogram phases

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Detected peaks. Outputs peaks organized as follows: one llll per channel, then one llll per frame with the onset as first element, then one llll per peak, each peak being in the form: [position amplitude phase], where phase is only present if a temporal buffer or a phase spectrogram has been provided.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: If an ordinary (temporal) buffer is input, by default a Short-Time Fourier Transform is computed and its peaks are found. If one wants temporal peaks instead, one should set the spectral attribute to zero. If a spectral buffer is input (with as many channels as bins), then the peaks are directly computed from the spectral representation.
